newsitem.title: USA: Bay Networks named in shareholder lawsuit.
newsitem.headline: Bay Networks named in shareholder lawsuit.

text.p: Attorneys filed a lawsuit against Bay Networks Inc on behalf of shareholders who bought stock between July 25, 1995 and October 14, 1996, three law firms said in a statement.
Bay Networks was not immediately available for comment.

The complaint alleges that Bay Networks made misleading statements regarding, among other things, Bay's management and organization, its sales, revenues and profits, its products and capabilities, and its overall competitive market position, the law firms said.
The law firms involved include Zwerling, Schachter, Zwerling LLP; Prongay & Borderud; and Berman, DeValerio, Pease & Tobacco.
